audio_description: We have chopped the onions and tomatoes. Now let's prepare a paste for the biriyani. For that, we have taken 3 big pieces of ginger, 30 cloves of garlic, and 9 green chillies. Grind them all in the mixer. We have ground them finely. Now chop some coriander leaves and mint leaves for the biriyani.

audio_description: We have taken a handful of coriander leaves and a portion of mint leaves. We can cut this before adding to the masala. Now we prepare the "besta" for the biriyani — finely chopped and fried big onions. This gives a special taste to Malabar biriyani. We've taken 4 onions here. Chop and fry them.

audio_description: Switch off the stove and keep the chicken aside. Start cooking the rice now. If you're experienced, you can cook the rice simultaneously with the chicken to keep the biriyani hot for "dum." Heat a pan. After frying the onions, use half a glass of the remaining oil. Reduce quantity if avoiding too much oil.

audio_description: Store leftover biriyani in the fridge. When sautéing onion and chicken, don’t discard water from the lid — pour it back. We added rose water for aroma. Don’t overdo it. Real biriyani flavor develops only after "dum."
